body:
You're right, I'm seeing the same thing:

    f = Foo.new
    %w[public protected private].each { |vis| puts "#{vis} methods: " + f.send("#{vis}_methods", false).inspect }

    public methods: [:pub]
    protected methods: [:prot, :protalias, :protaliasmethod]
    private methods: [:priv, :privalias, :privaliasmethod]

Here's the issue in a clean Rails console (until now I've been whacking around inside the debugger):

    $ rails console
    Loading development environment (Rails 3.2.11)
    irb(main):001:0> require 'rails/generators'
    => true
    irb(main):002:0> require 'rails/generators/active_record/migration/migration_generator'
    => true
    irb(main):003:0> ActiveRecord::Generators::MigrationGenerator.all_tasks.keys
    => ["singular_name", "create_migration_file"]

But the alias visibility test appears to do the right thing.

    irb(main):004:0> class Foo; protected; attr_reader :prot; alias :protalias :prot; end
    => nil
    irb(main):005:0> Foo.new.public_methods(false)
    => []
    irb(main):006:0> Foo.new.protected_methods(false)
    => [:prot, :protalias]

weird.  still looking...
